fields.descr: The practice is implemented across all activities/services/products/offices/ facilities to which it could apply.
The practice is implemented across roughly 50% OR MORE of the activities/services/products/offices/ facilities to which it could apply.
The practice is implemented across roughly 50% OR LESS of the activities/services/products/offices/ facilities to which it could apply.
The practice is implemented across negligible to no activities/services/products/offices/ facilities to which it could apply.
The practice is not applicable to the organization, or the organization has no influence or control over its implementation.

fields.title: ESG/Environmental practices
fields.description: Please answer the core Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) questions, then pick an industry segment and assess your organization against environmental practices in your organization's industry of choice.

fields.title: Core Environment, Social and Governance (ESG) Assessment

(3) Does your company have a formalized ESG strategy and performance targets that: 1/ Define a future vision of ESG performance, 2/ Are clear, actionable, and achievable, 3/ Are resourced effectively, 4/ Address material issues for the business?

(3a) Has your company assigned formal responsibility for directing and overseeing ESG performance to top/executive management, and designated a point person(s) responsible for implementing strategy and meeting targets?

(3b) Does your company report internally, including to top management, on strategy: key ESG issues (revealed by materiality analysis), resiliency, risk, business continuity, progress toward goals, and plans/needs to address gaps towards your targets?

(3c) Does your company report externally on strategy: program elements, key ESG issues and goals, challenges, resiliency, and continual improvement efforts in accordance with a reputable reporting standard (e.g. GRI, SASB, TCFD)?
(3d) Does your company have ESG strategy and reports, targets, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) periodically (every 5 years or sooner) validated by an independent third party?
(4) Has your company conducted a systematic, rigorous assessment to identify and prioritize material ESG impacts, issues and opportunities?
Material ESG Impacts, Issues and Opportunities
(4a) How was the ESG assessment done, and in what year?
(4b) Please describe the three most material ESG impacts, issues and opportunities identified for your company?
(4c) Please describe your company's strategies, related goals and performance metrics related to each of these three material ESG issues.
(5) Does your company have an Employee Code of Conduct?
Does your company’s Employee Code of Conduct contain sections pertinent to ...
(5j - Employee Code of Conduct) If yes - What monitoring or audit systems are in place to ensure compliance with the Employee Code of Conduct?
(7) Does your company have a Supplier Code of Conduct and/or Human Rights Policy in place?
Does your company’s Supplier Code of Conduct and/or Human Rights Policy contain sections pertinent to ...
(7k - Supplier Code of Conduct) Percentage of targeted suppliers that have signed the Supplier Code of Conduct?
(7l - Supplier Code of Conduct) If yes what is the percentage of targeted suppliers with contracts that include clauses on environmental, labor, and human rights requirements?
(7m - Supplier Code of Conduct) If yes - What monitoring or audit systems are in place to ensure compliance with the Supplier Code of Conduct?
(21) Are there any conflict minerals or additional minerals of concern (including: cobalt, tin, tantalum, tungsten, or gold) in the product(s) that your company manufactures, subcontracts, or sells?
(21a) If yes - Has your company published a due diligence report on conflict minerals (including or not including cobalt)?
(22) What are your company policies related to sourcing minerals of concern?

(23) Does your company source any of the specific materials, minerals, or products from the related countries listed on the Department of Labor "List of Goods Produced by Child Labor or Forced Labor" (available here https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ilab/reports/child-labor/list-of-goods)?
(23a) If yes - How is your company ensuring that there is no Child Labor or Forced Labor in your supply chain?
(24) What are your company policies related to sourcing materials from regions of concern?

(8) Has your company had any significant code of conduct breaches including but not limited to breaches resulting in fines, class action lawsuits, or repeated breaches of Codes of Conduct in the past 36 months?

(9) Has your company received or been responsible for a Notice of Violation (NOV), Consent Order or fine over USD $10,000 from an environmental agency, or an environmental event that required reporting to an environmental agency in the past 36 months?
(10) Has your company implemented an environmental management system that conforms with a recognized international (e.g. ISO 14001) or local standard?
(10b) Is the system certified to a recognized local or international standard?
(10c) Is the system periodically (e.g. every 5 years)  audited internally and by an independent third party?
(10a) Please indicate the coverage of the environmental management system across your business and/or facilities (e.g. % of owned facilities with an ISO 14001 certificate)?
(14a) Does your company report total Scope 1 GHG emissions publicly?
(14b) Have Scope 1 GHG Emissions data been third-party verified within last 2 years?
(15a) Does your company report total Scope 2 GHG emissions publicly?
(15b) Have Scope 2 GHG emissions data been third-party verified within last 2 years?
(16a) Does your company report total Scope 3 GHG emissions publicly?
(16b) Have Scope 3 GHG emissions data been third-party verified within last 2 years?
(20c) Does your company report waste generated and recycled publicly?
Has the waste measurement methodoly been third-party verified within the last 2 years?
(11c) Does your company report water withdrawn, discharged and re-used publicy?
(11d) Have water data been third-party verified within the last 2 years?
Does your company report internally or externally Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on ...
(24b) ... Diversity of Executive Leadership and/or Board?
(24g) ... Days Away, Restricted, and Transfer (DART) Rate?
(16o) End of life treatment of sold products
(18) Total Hazardous Waste Generated for Disposal
(19) Total Non-Hazardous Waste Generated for Disposal
(20) Total Waste Recycled and Diverted (including source; e.g. composting,  etc.)
When do you expect to achieve your Scope 1 GHG Emissions target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
Is this a science-based target, net-zero target, or other?
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
When do you expect to achieve your Scope 2 GHG Emissions target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
Is this a science-based target, net-zero target, or other?
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
When do you expect to achieve your Scope 3 GHG Emissions target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
Is this a science-based target, net-zero target, or other?
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
When do you expect to achieve your waste reduction target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
When do you expect to achieve your water use target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
(25) Does your company have a target for diverse spend publicly communicated?
(25c) When do you expect to achieve your diverse spend and/or representation target? (Please describe the target, or why you do not have a target, in comments)
If yes, What progress has been made on your target (%)?
If yes - Does your company define as a diverse supplier ...?
(25p) If yes - Do you require third-party certification to verify a supplier diverse status?

Background

fields.title: Has your company assigned formal responsibility for directing and overseeing ESG performance to top/executive management, and designatied a point person(s) responsible for implementing requirements and commitments.

Report internally, including to top management, on strategy: key ESG issues (revealed by materiality analysis), risk and crisis mitigation, progress toward goals, and plans/needs to address shortfalls.
What are your primary concerns for the next year?
